work.summary: Working on efficient Applied Machine Learning and AI Development
highlights: Led the development of 2D image processing pipelines across tasks including semantic segmentation, objection detection, and classification, applying architectures such as foundation model (e.g., SAM), vision-language models, and UNets variants. Applications span marine habitat mapping, digital health, remote sensing, robotics navigation, and precision agriculture.
Developed GenAI augmentation pipelines based on conditional diffusion, prompt engineering, and adaptive sampling to boost model robustness for marine time obstacle detection.
Trained multi-modal vision–language models (CLIP, BLIP, Qwen-VL) for semantic segmentation and classification for robotics navigation.
Leveraged LLMs (ChatGPT-4o, Qwen) for prompt generation, caption alignment, and text-to-image conditioning.
Built end-to-end Retrieval-Augmented Generation (RAG) pipelines for semantic search and knowledge-grounded generation.
Hands-on experience building agentic AI workflows: designing LangGraph-based agents with memory, iteration and RAG.
Develop code and manage version control to ensure integrity, track changes, and support team collaboration via Bitbucket.
Designed efficient deployment pipelines using model compression, quantization, and Pytorch-to-ONNX conversion, deployed via Triton Inference Server and Edge devices(e.g., Raspherry Pi)
Produce research publications and contribute to patents, conferences and journal publications.
Managed project progress through Jira and Confluence, tracking milestones, documenting results, and coordinating updates with cross-functional teams.
Coordinate Data61 Imaging and Computer Vision Reading Group to promote continuous learning and knowledge sharing across teams.
Supervise PhD student by setting clear research milestones, providing technical guidance, and support publication-focused outcomes.
Collaborated with cross-disciplinary teams (6–8 members each) of scientists, engineers, and domain experts, contributing to research design, technical mentoring, and stakeholder presentations.

work.summary: Worked on project fine-grained classification with few labels
highlights: Analyzed fine-grained visual datasets where classes exhibit subtle differences and overlapping features under limited labeled data conditions, addressing challenges of high intra-class variability and cross-domain distribution shifts.
Developed machine learning models capable of learning effectively from small datasets and generalizing to new domains.
Designed and implemented data preprocessing and augmentation pipelines to improve model robustness and reduce overfitting in low-label learning scenarios.
Produced research publications and contributed to conferences and journal articles.
Develop code and manage version control, and shared within team to promote collaboration.
Managed GPU workstation clusters and AWS VOLTA cloud infrastructure for the lab.
Supervise PhD student by setting clear research milestones and providing guidance toward achieving publication-focused outcomes.

work.summary: Worked on Robust Machine Learning for Noisy and Incomplete Data
highlights: Analyzed data reliability under noisy, incomplete, and outlier-prone conditions, identifying and detecting abnormal samples through statistical inspection to understand their impact on model performance and generalization.

Developed robust statistical and machine learning algorithms, including low-rank regression, tensor factorization, and sparse representation methods, to enhance model accuracy and stability under corrupted or skewed data conditions.
Designed adaptive weighting and regularization strategies to automatically suppress the impact of abnormal data points during training, improving predictive accuracy and model interpretability.
Produced research publications and contributed to conferences and journal articles.
Attend international conferences and workshops to present our work, exchange ideas with peers, and strengthen collaboration across research groups.
